00010 // Check against redundant including
00011 #ifndef TT_MULTITAP_H
00012 #define TT_MULTITAP_H
00013 
00014 // Include appropriate headers
00015 #include "tt_audio_base.h"

00018 /********************************************************
00019         CLASS INTERFACE / IMPLEMENTATION
00020         
00021         The entire class is implemented inline for speed.
00022  ********************************************************/
00023 
00024 class tt_multitap:public tt_audio_base{
00025 
00026         private:
00027                 enum constants{
00028                         k_buffersize_type_samples = 0,
00029                         k_buffersize_type_ms = 1,
00030                         k_buffersize_type,
00031                         k_max_num_taps = 100,
00032                 };
00033                 bool                                                    buffersize_type;                                // Size of the delay buffer...
00034                 tt_attribute_value                              buffersize_ms;
00035                 tt_attribute_value_discrete             buffersize_samples;
00036                 tt_attribute_value                              delay_ms[k_max_num_taps];               // length of the individual delays...
00037                 tt_attribute_value_discrete             delay_samples[k_max_num_taps];
00038                 tt_attribute_value                              gain[k_max_num_taps];                   // gain (in db) of each delay
00039                 tt_attribute_value                              master_gain;                                    // master output gain control (in db)
00040                 tt_attribute_value_discrete             num_taps;                                               // number of delay taps active in the unit
00041                 
00042                 tt_sample_vector                                buffer;                                                 // pointer to first location in the buffer
00043                 tt_sample_vector                                buffer_end;                                             // pointer to last location in the buffer
00044                 tt_sample_vector                                buffer_in;                                              // "write" pointer for the buffer
00045                 tt_sample_vector                                buffer_out[k_max_num_taps];             // "read" pointers from the buffer for each delay
00046         
00047         public:
00048                 enum selectors{
00049                         k_buffersize_ms,
00050                         k_buffersize_samples,
00051                         k_delay_ms,
00052                         k_delay_samples,
00053                         k_gain,
00054                         k_master_gain,
00055                         k_num_taps,
00056                 };      
00057 
00058 
00059         // OBJECT LIFE ************************************
00060         
00061         tt_multitap(tt_attribute_value_discrete value)          // Instance Constructor: INT ARGUMENT
00062         {
00063                 reset();
00064                 set_attr(k_buffersize_samples, value);
00065         }
00066 
00067         tt_multitap(tt_attribute_value value)                           // Instance Constructor: FLOAT ARGUMENT
00068         {
00069                 reset();
00070                 set_attr(k_buffersize_ms, value);
00071         }
00072 
00073         ~tt_multitap()                                                                          // Instance Destructor
00074         {       
00075                 mem_free(buffer);       
00076         }
00077 
00078 
00079         // OVER-RIDEN SR METHOD ***************************
00080         void set_sr(int value){
00081                 if(value != sr){                // Do this only if the SR has changed
00082                         short i;
00083                         
00084                         sr = value;
00085                         r_sr = 1.0 / sr;
00086                         m_sr = 0.001 * sr;
00087                 
00088                         if(buffersize_type)     // if the size was spec'd in ms then resize (don't do anything if spec'd in samples)
00089                                 set_attr(k_buffersize_ms, buffersize_ms);
00090                         // THE ABOVE MAY CAUSE PROBLEMS(!!!) BECAUSE IT WILL CAUSE TROUBLE FOR THE REALTIME PERFORM ROUTINES
00091                         for(i=0; i<num_taps; i++)
00092                                 set_attr(k_delay_ms, i, delay_ms[i]);
00093                 }
00094         }
00095         
00096         // OVER-RIDEN VS METHOD ***************************
00097         void set_vectorsize(int value)
00098         {
00099                 if(value != vectorsize){
00100                         short i;
00101                         
00102                         //post("setting vs: %i (was: %i)", value, vectorsize);                  
00103                         vectorsize = value;
00104                         if(buffersize_type)     // if the size was spec'd in ms then resize (don't do anything if spec'd in samples)
00105                                 set_attr(k_buffersize_ms, buffersize_ms);
00106                         // THE ABOVE MAY CAUSE PROBLEMS(!!!) BECAUSE IT WILL CAUSE TROUBLE FOR THE REALTIME PERFORM ROUTINES
00107                         for(i=0; i<num_taps; i++)
00108                                 set_attr(k_delay_ms, i, delay_ms[i]);                   
00109                 }
00110         }
00111 
00112 
00113 
00114         
00115         // ATTRIBUTES *************************************
00116         
00117         void set_attr(tt_selector sel, tt_attribute_value val)                          // "GLOBAL" ATTRIBUTES FOR THIS OBJECT...
00118         {
00119                 switch(sel){
00120                         case k_buffersize_ms:
00121                                 buffersize_type = k_buffersize_type_ms;
00122                                 buffersize_ms = val;
00123                                 buffersize_samples = (tt_attribute_value_discrete)(buffersize_ms * m_sr);
00124                                 init_buffer();
00125                                 break;
00126                         case k_buffersize_samples:
00127                                 buffersize_type = k_buffersize_type_samples;
00128                                 buffersize_samples = (tt_attribute_value_discrete)val;
00129                                 buffersize_ms = buffersize_samples / sr * 1000.0;
00130                                 init_buffer();
00131                                 break;
00132                         case k_master_gain:
00133                                 master_gain = decibels_to_amplitude(val);
00134                                 break;
00135                         case k_num_taps:
00136                                 num_taps = clip((int)val, 1, k_max_num_taps - 1);
00137                                 break;
00138                 }
00139         }
00140         
00141         tt_attribute_value get_attr(tt_selector sel)
00142         {
00143                 switch(sel){
00144                         case k_buffersize_ms:
00145                                 return buffersize_ms;
00146                         case k_buffersize_samples:
00147                                 return (tt_attribute_value)buffersize_samples;
00148                         case k_master_gain:
00149                                 return amplitude_to_decibels(master_gain);
00150                         case k_num_taps:
00151                                 return (tt_attribute_value)num_taps;
00152                         default:
00153                                 return -1;
00154                 }
00155         }
00156         
00157         
00158         void set_attr(tt_selector sel, int tap, tt_attribute_value val) // "TAP-SPECIFIC" ATTRIBUTES FOR THIS OBJECT...
00159         {
00160                 tap = clip(tap, 0, k_max_num_taps -1);          // range-limit the tap number
00161                 switch(sel){
00162                         case k_delay_ms:
00163                                 delay_ms[tap] = clip(val, 0.0F, buffersize_ms);
00164                                 delay_samples[tap] = (tt_attribute_value_discrete)(delay_ms[tap] * m_sr);
00165                                 position_playheads();
00166                                 break;
00167                         case k_delay_samples:
00168                                 delay_samples[tap] = clip((tt_attribute_value_discrete)val, 0L, buffersize_samples);
00169                                 delay_ms[tap] = (tt_attribute_value)delay_samples[tap] / sr * 1000.0;
00170                                 position_playheads();
00171                                 break;
00172                         case k_gain:
00173                                 gain[tap] = decibels_to_amplitude(val);
00174                                 break;
00175                                 // !!!!NEED TO CALL A FUNCTION HERE TO REPOSITION THE PLAY HEADS!!!!
00176                 }
00177         }
00178         
00179         tt_attribute_value get_attr(tt_selector sel, int tap)
00180         {
00181                 tap = clip(tap, 0, k_max_num_taps -1);          // range-limit the tap number
00182                 switch(sel){
00183                         case k_delay_ms:
00184                                 return delay_ms[tap];
00185                         case k_delay_samples:
00186                                 return (tt_attribute_value)delay_samples[tap];
00187                         case k_gain:
00188                                 return gain[tap];
00189                         default:
00190                                 return -1;
00191                 }
00192         }
00193         
00194         
00195         // DSP ROUTINE(S) *********************************
00196         
00197         void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *out)
00198         {
00199                 tt_sample_value temp;
00200                 short i;
00201                 temp_vs = in->vectorsize;
00202                 
00203                 if(buffer == NULL)                                                              // there was a problem allocating memory
00204                         return;                                                                         //      (can happen during fast sr/vs switching in auval)
00205                 
00206                 while(temp_vs--){
00207                         *buffer_in++ = *in->vector++;                           // record input with the write-pointer
00208                         temp = 0.0;
00209                         for(i=0; i < num_taps; i++)                                     // For each tap in the delay line:
00210                                 temp += (*buffer_out[i]++ * gain[i]);           //      get the output, scale it, and move to the next sample
00211                         *out->vector++ = temp * master_gain;            // OUTPUT
00212                         
00213 //                      if(buffer_in > buffer_end-10)                                   // Wrap the record head if necessary
00214 //                      if(buffer_in > buffer_end-1)                                    // Wrap the record head if necessary
00215                         if(buffer_in > buffer_end)                                              // Wrap the record head if necessary
00216 
00217                                 buffer_in = buffer;             
00218                         for(i=0; i<num_taps; i++){                                      // Wrap the play heads if neccessary
00219                                 if(buffer_out[i] > buffer_end)
00220                                         buffer_out[i] = buffer;
00221                         }
00222                 }
00223                 in->reset(); out->reset();
00224         }
00225         
00226         
00227         // ADDITIONAL METHODS *****************************
00228         
00229         void clear(void)
00230         {
00231                 long i;
00232                 for(i=0; i<buffersize_samples; i++){
00233                         buffer[i] = 0.0;
00234                 }
00235         }
00236         
00237         private:
00238         
00239         void init_buffer()
00240         {
00241                 mem_free(buffer);       // release previously used memory (if any)
00242                 buffer = (tt_sample_value *)mem_alloc((buffersize_samples + 1) * sizeof(tt_sample_value));
00243                 if(buffer){
00244                         buffer_in = buffer;                                                                     // point the record-head to the first location in the buffer
00245                         buffer_end = buffer + buffersize_samples;                       // point the end-pointer to the last location in the buffer
00246                         position_playheads();
00247                         clear();
00248                 }
00249                 else{
00250                         error("tt_multitap could not allocate memory for the delay buffer!");
00251                         buffer = NULL;
00252                 }
00253         }
00254 
00255         void reset(void)
00256         {
00257                 short i;
00258                 
00259                 for(i=0; i<k_max_num_taps; i++){
00260                         gain[i] = delay_ms[i] = delay_samples[i] = 0;
00261                         buffer_out[i] = 0;
00262                 }
00263                 buffersize_ms = buffersize_samples = 0;
00264                 buffersize_type = 0;
00265                 buffer = buffer_in = buffer_end = 0;
00266                 master_gain = num_taps = 0;
00267 
00268                 set_sr(global_sr);
00269         }
00270         
00271         void position_playheads()                               // point play heads to the correct location
00272         {
00273                 short i;
00274                 for(i=0; i<k_max_num_taps; i++){                
00275                         buffer_out[i] = buffer_in - delay_samples[i];
00276                         if(buffer_out[i] < buffer)
00277                                 buffer_out[i] = buffer_end + (buffer_out[i] - buffer) + 1;
00278                 }
00279         }
00280         
00281 };

00284 #endif // TT_MULTITAP_H
